lifePoints.title: Birth
lifePoints.description: Douglas Adams is born in Cambridge, England. It was widely regarded as a great move.

lifePoints.title: Education
lifePoints.description: Adams attends St John's College, Cambridge, where he studies English literature.

lifePoints.title: H2G2's Radio Series
lifePoints.description: Adams creates the radio series adaptation of 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy,' which gains widespread popularity.

lifePoints.title: H2G2's Publication
lifePoints.description: The first book in the 'Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' series is published, becoming a cult classic.

lifePoints.title: Success
lifePoints.description: Adams achieves success as a writer, penning several best-selling books and scripts.

lifePoints.title: Collaboration
lifePoints.description: Adams collaborates with the comedy group Monty Python on various projects.

lifePoints.title: Last Chance to See
lifePoints.description: Adams co-authors 'Last Chance to See,' a book highlighting endangered species and environmental issues.

lifePoints.title: Death
lifePoints.description: Douglas Adams passes away unexpectedly in Santa Barbara, California, at the age of 49. Don't panic.
